items.content:
iOS Engineer - Full remote in Europe

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Carsharing, Marketplace, Transportation
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Heetch | No office location

Technologies

ios
swift
reactive-programming
mobile
autolayout

Job description

⚠️Read before applying:

We're a young company iterating over our remote culture so for now, we're only working with people in locations where the time zone is: -3 hours > Paris time zone < +3 hours

Engineering @Heetch

Tech Stack: https://stackshare.io/heetch/engineering

Our team's values

  • Transparency: We discuss everything openly within the team. Our speak up culture is strong.
  • Remote first: Our team is fully distributed, and we work hard at that, but feel free to work from any of our offices in Paris, London, Brussels or Casablanca.
  • The courage to fail: We celebrate the wins, but more importantly we're not afraid to fail, we always learn and go again.
  • Team Unity: No one is left behind.
  • Code quality: It's not software without tests.

What will be your role?

We're hiring for talent, not location, that is why you will find members of our group based remotely throughout Europe. You'll join one of our cross-functional product team and will be its proud iOS representative.

There are plenty of challenges each of them are tackling at the moment such as:

  • Driver: create a scalable and reliable platform used by dozen of thousands of drivers on a daily basis
  • Payment: make in-app payment management easy as pie for users.
  • Ride flow: improve our ride flow by making it more modular while we are expanding in new countries with completely different approaches of using the product

... and many others!

Does it sound like you?

  • You have more than 5 years of experience in iOS development.
  • You also have at least 2 years of experience in using Reactive programming.
  • You've already worked with Swift in Production.
  • You understand the iOS SDK and application lifecycle.
  • You've got knowledge in common architectural patterns.
  • You're skilled in UI using AutoLayout.
  • You're thorough when it comes to test coverage and other best practices.

Bonus points ;)

  • If you have contributed to open source projects, it would be a plus.
  • If you know about managing the lifecycle of background services and their impact on battery usage, it would also be a bonus.

What will you do?

  • Work closely with Product, Backend and Data Analysts to build highly impactful features.
  • Work in a release train cycle (we ship often ).
  • Optimise performance and help solve technical and product problems for our large pool of iOS drivers
  • Be a vital member of the broader iOS team at Heetch and contribute to core architecture and design discussions.
  • Work closely with engineers from other product teams building cross-team features at scale.
  • Participate in Code Reviews and provide feedback to your colleagues.
  • Share knowledge with everyone and help your team to grow.
  • Have the freedom to experiment. Intrigued by a new tech or library? Go for it! Let's see how it improves our services.
  • Routinely own and manage releases to the App store.

What will be your main challenges?

Our app is one, of the few mobile apps, running in the foreground for up to seven hours straight on drivers phones. This rather unique use case brings fun challenges with handling the lifecycle of the app.

  • Network and GPS management: We need to provide accurate information and price suggestions to our community. This means making sure every driver gets important notifications in any network conditions, providing GPS location as accurate as possible for the pricing and tracking.
  • UI & UX: Ride-sharing apps are a really special case in app design. They all revolve around a map and the conventional navigation patterns like list view and navigation controls need heavy tweaking to make for great user experience.
  • One way data flow and functional pattern: We are passionate about software architecture. We've built the core of our apps using Rx and want to push this forward in both the data and the UI layers. Ideally, our team will grow big enough to be able to push forward what mobile programming means and we'll contribute back to all those amazing open source projects we learned from.

What's next?

If your application is selected, the process will be composed of 4 steps:

  1. Non-technical interview with the Engineering Manager of your potential team (1h30)
  2. Take home assignment (~5 days deadline)
  3. Interview with your future teammates (1h)
  4. Day on site (Paris) to meet your future stakeholders
Apply now

About Heetch

Heetch is a mobility app with a simple mission: We want people to enjoy going out.
Every night and every day, our drivers are doing their best to make their rides unforgettable and friendly! We are focused on young people's expectations and are competing within a fast-paced market.

The service launched in Paris in September 2013 has been growing ever since, with thousands of daily rides in France, Belgium, and Morocco. With more than 1 million users in Europe, we are proud to be one of the fastest growing French startups!

Benefits

  • Full remote and flexible ways of working
  • Paid conferences attendance/travel
  • Code Retreat
  • 2 company seminars
  • Travel budget to visit your co-workers
  • Heetch Credits

Ionic Mobile Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time

Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

mobile
android
ios
ionic
ionic3

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking a Mobile Developer who has a strong background in Ionic to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient mobile applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Ionic framework experience required
  • Ionic Pro experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies* Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

- Writing code using best practice techniques, making it easy to maintain with low technical debt.
- You will have ownership over the code you create, meaning that you will write and execute unit and integrations tests.
- You will work with the Research, Data Science and Product teams on metrics that will become relevant in the future.
- Your work will be varied, writing new and improving existing code, refining testing and deployment processes.

What they need from you :

- Android Studio and Android Debug Bridge
- Java + Kotlin
- Proven capability in SDK App development
- Understanding of SOLID principles
- Understanding of SCRUM methodology

Your benefits:

- Highly competitive salary
- Very socially collaborative culture
- Mostly remote work!
- Private medical care
- Contribution pension scheme
- Personal Development Budget

Experience and Skills Required:

- 3-4 years Android Development experience
- Fluent in JAVA

items.content:
Mobile Chapter Lead (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Application Development
  • Mobile Web Design

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €195 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.
    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. 

    Your mission as an experienced Leader & React Native Developer is to enable teams to build great solutions with delighting UI’s and an amazing mobile user experience. Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    Your Responsibilities:

    • You are Chapter lead, with accountability for the improvement of our overall mobile engineering capability, including talent, workflows and tools
    • You are Key contributor in a cross-functional mobile team
    • You are a hands-on team lead and mentor
    • You ensure a high working morale, teamspirit, and productivity
    • You develop both your chapter’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs
    • You coach your chapter to remove obstacles independently, but you also get your hands dirty, when needed
    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility
    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organization
    • You are a great communicator and empathetic motivator when needed 

    Main requirements

     Your Profile:

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience
    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in a collaborative way
    • Entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment
    • You have strong experience (3y)  with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcases your experience
    • You have a deep understanding of the app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
    • You are an open-minded and creative team player enjoying constructive code and architecture discussions
    • Writing clean, maintainable and well-documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code
    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus
    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory 

     

    Our Benefits:

    Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.content:
Cross platform App Developer (IoT)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Broadband, LTE, Smart Home
Company size: 5k–10k people
Company type: Public
Company: Sercomm | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London

Technologies

android
rust
kotlin
swift
ios

Job description

Sercomm are venturing out into many new emerging businesses to position for future growth. We are looking to hire a cross platform mobile application developer. We are a new regional business unit within Sercomm and you will have significant influence and ownership of your work. This role will be part of a wider international structure that includes hardware engineering, software development, industrial/mechanical design, UX and global sales. 

Our current mobile stack uses React-Native and Rust for both iOS and Android. Our firmware is written in Rust and runs on both Openwrt and our own Android distribution. Our cloud services are mostly written in Erlang and continuously deployed to AWS. We like automation, type safety and functional programming, but are pragmatic in practice.

Our development offices are in Nottingham, and our headquarters are in Taipei (Taiwan).

In principle we are open to discuss remote working providing the candidate can visit the office a few times a month.  In practice this would mean a candidate would need to be Midlands or at least England based.

This is a UK remote role, currently only available to UK residents. There will be opportunities for travel to Asia.

We are hiring a remote cross platform mobile application developer to:

  • Build industry leading mobile apps for smart devices on a global scale
  • Build a team of developers for the delivery of Android and iOS projects.
  • Promote improvements in development practice and technology.
  • Continuously learn and challenge the organization concerning new practices, processes, technologies, and languages

Required Skills

  • Demonstrable experience of developing native applications for both iOS and Android
  • Design sensibility and instinct for what makes a good mobile user experience
  • Experience leading design and software technical specifications
  • CI/CD
Apply now

About Sercomm

We are a newly formed division of Sercomm in the UK.  Sercomm acquired the engineers from Presciense who are now continuing the work in energy, telecoms and home automation they started.  Employees joining this team will play a key role in directing the technology over the next years.

Benefits

  • Enrolment in UK pension
  • Private health care
  • Flexible working from remote and/or Nottingham

About us

At iFit we do remote teams right. Join a great company that is growing fast and with the right work/life balance.

iFit focuses on connecting everybody to everything fitness. We love software that talks to real things. Our parent company is the world's largest fitness manufacturer ( iFit,NordicTrack, ProForm, Gold's Gym, Freemotion, 10+ others), which provides us a LOT of devices,  embedded tablets, and other exciting physical things to engage with.

Perhaps the best representation we can say about our culture, how we value people, and the work you will be a part of by joining our iFit team is that we have exceptionally low turnover, which is a reflection of those values.




About the work   

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • Experience developing Android and/or iOS applications

About you 

  • Passionate about mobile technologies and coding the *right* way
  • Deliver a product that is centered around a great customer experience
  • Create mobile applications that will be used by millions
  • Create quality code that is easy to test and maintain
  • Participate in code reviews and trainings

  • Free piece of fitness equipment of your choice

items.content:
Junior IOS Developer - Norfolk - Remote Working - Salary Negotiable

We are working with an expanding Norfolk based software owner. They are seeking applicants for a newly formed native iOS development position. Ideally you will have a degree in computer science or similar, the role would suit to a Graqduate / Junior developer with some level of experience in programming. The successful candidate will have practical experience, together with a positive attitude and good interpersonal communication, team working skills and a strong eagerness to learn. In return you will be offered every opportunity to develop your skills and you'll work alongside experienced developers who have extensive experience of the whole life cycle of App development.

This opportunity can offer full remote working.

Responsibilities and Duties

You will work as part of the development team, who produce Apps for a wide spectrum of products. Reporting to the Development Team Leader, you will contribute to every stage of the development and build of Apps. This will include activities ranging from client engagement through to post launch maintenance.

The level of responsibility will increase with your development and technical ability.

Qualifications and Skills

We are ideally looking for someone with the following essential skills:

An understanding of Object-Orientated programming
A degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience developing iOS apps using Objective C and Swift
Experience using relational and non-relational databases
Experience working with RESTful web services
Experience using third party APIs
Understand the importance of source code management and basic git usage
Strong organisational and problem-solving skills
Able to work in a team
Experience of determining user requirements and developing applications to match them
Ability to evaluate alternatives and understand business implications and impact
Proactive and self-motivated
Strong sense of ownership, urgency and drive.
Desirables:

Published one or more iOS application to the App Store
Experience developing cross-platform mobile applications
Knowledge in web-based front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Preference will be given to candidates with experience of cross-platform experience

Job description

Who’s Clearcover? 

Clearcover is the smarter car insurance company. We use powerful technology to offer everyday drivers better coverage for less money. We’re proud to be one of the fastest growing startups in Chicago, and we’re currently looking to add a few more extraordinary people to our team.

You will work on a Kotlin pod with other JVM devs and engage closely with the greater Product and Engineering team to deeply understand our technical products and ensure they are being built with the highest quality.  

What will you do?

  • Design and architect new features and services
  • Work with product to help define and refine requirements
  • Write well-tested and robust code in Kotlin

What do you have?

  • Experience developing modern web backends in a statically typed language
  • Experience writing tests using kotlin.test, JUnit, or ScalaTest
  • Familiarity with both Object-Oriented and Functional design principles

Nice to haves:

  • Experience scaling distributed systems
  • Experience with Property-based testing
  • Experience with data models beyond simple CRUD

What's in it for you?

  • Unlimited vacation, we hire adults 
  • Equity for all employees, so you own a piece of the pie too 
  • Dental and Vision, we've got you covered 100%
  • Medical, we cover 90% of your premium, 75% of your dependents and contribute to your HSA and HRA (cha-ching)
  • We invest in your future by contributing 3% of your salary to a 401(K), even if you don't
  • Come to work pre-taxed through our FSA commuter benefits 
  • and yes, we have unlimited LaCroix, beer, snacks and the occasional ice cream social 
Apply now

About Clearcover

Who’s Clearcover? 
Clearcover is the smarter car insurance company. We use powerful technology to offer everyday drivers better coverage for less money. We’re proud to be one of the fastest growing startups in Chicago, and we’re currently looking to add a few more extraordinary people to our team.

We've recently raised $45 million in our series B and have doubled in size since January. We have a product and engineering team that are smart, some might say brilliant. We celebrate success with Friday Wins and have some pretty cool req3rs

Benefits

  • We cover 90% of the medical premium, rumor is our plans rock!
  • We cover 100% Vision for you and your family, seeing is believing!
  • We contribute 3% to your 401k whether you do or not
  • Everyone gets options, we're in it to win it!
  • Unlimited Vacation, we hire adults!
  • We celebrate wins on Friday (often with a refreshing beverage in hand)
  • Our engineers have amazing superpowers, learn from the best.
  • We have 85% employee NPS, I know it's crazy!
  • We cover 100% of your Dental for you and your family, we value smiles!
  • We supplement your STD so you get 12 week paid maternity leave.

items.content:
Ionic Mobile Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

mobile
android
ios
ionic
ionic3

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking a Mobile Developer who has a strong background in Ionic to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient mobile applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Ionic framework experience required
  • Ionic Pro experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies* Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

Senior Software Developer for macOS

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: B2C, Cybersecurity
Company size: 201–500 people
Company type: Private
Company: Chengbao | Hong Kong

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+08:00) Hong Kong +/- 6 hours
Office Location: Hong Kong. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes

Technologies

swift
objective-c
macos
tdd

Job description

We’re looking for an experienced MacOS Developer

Chengbao is looking for a MacOS Developer. Join our team to build user-friendly apps and services used by hundreds of thousands of consumers world-wide.

Responsibilities

Your exact responsibilities will depend on your skills and interests, but here are some examples:

  • Implement new features with superb code quality and high levels of automated test coverage. You’ll focus on macOS with Objective C, but ideally will be involved in other languages and platforms as well. We use Go for code that’s shared across platforms. You’ll need to become an expert in Go as well. Your colleagues will coach you.
  • Work closely with the rest of the team to define the product vision, review specs, and make architecture decisions.
  • Collaborate with colleagues building similar applications for iOS, Android, Windows, and Linux.
  • Write specs for highly technical features.
  • Do code-reviews with other developers on the team.

Requirements

  • Expert Mac OS X Objective C developer creating beautiful client-side applications
  • Expert in writing automated tests
  • Deep understanding of Mac user interface design guidelines
  • Deep understanding of object-oriented design principles and patterns
  • Ideally: You already have a good understanding of IP networking, or will be eager to learn this here.
  • Keen interest to learn Go
  • Passion for writing well-architected readable code that’s easy to maintain by a team of several developers

What we offer

  • Attractive compensation and benefits
  • Flexible working hours and a healthy work-life balance
  • Work in a challenging, collaborative, and fun environment

About us

At Chengbao, we’re leading the way to a more private and secure digital world. Consumers in over 180 countries around the globe rely on our industry-leading cybersecurity software and services.

We are an international tech company with hundreds of people worldwide and a core team in Hong Kong. We’re profitable, growing, and just getting started.

We hire world-class developers, product managers, and marketers in the industry, and give them the tools to succeed. Together, we ship beautiful, usable software for desktop and mobile that our customers use and love every day.

Ready to do the best work of your life? We’ve built just the place.

Apply now

About Chengbao

About us

At Chengbao, we’re leading the way to a more private and secure digital world. Consumers in over 180 countries around the globe rely on our industry-leading cybersecurity software and services.

We are an international tech company with hundreds of people worldwide and a core team in Hong Kong. We’re profitable, growing, and just getting started.

We hire world-class developers, product managers, and marketers in the industry, and give them the tools to succeed. Together, we ship beautiful, usable software for desktop and mobile that our customers use and love every day.

Ready to do the best work of your life? We’ve built just the place.

Benefits

  • Top Medical and Dental Insurance
  • Flexible working hours, great work life balance
  • Free breakfast
  • Fitness equipment
  • Ping-pong table and boardgames
  • High performance based bonus
  • Powerful hardware
  • No dress code
  • Frequent tech talks and sponsored learning
  • Learn from the best

items.content:
Mobile Application Developer
We are seeking a mobile developer to join our team. You will work under the CTO to lead the Android division for mobile development.
If you are passionate about mobile platforms and turning code into a snappy, easy to understand UX design, we would like to meet you. As a mobile developer, you will collaborate with other members of our development team to deliver full mobile solutions leveraging pre-existing and newly developed backend services. You will build the next generation of our mobile solutions.
Skills include working with backend APIs and building specialty code such as libraries and custom keyboard functions. The candidate should also have experience porting native apps from iOS to Android, with the ability to maintain exceptional user experience and familiar Android UI. Candidate must be familiar with Google Play store submission and maintenance.
If interested, please reply with your resume and a portfolio of mobile apps (or links to published apps). We are seeking a resource on the east coast of the US or Canada. If you are overseas, please do not reply as time zones are an issue for our team to function properly.

items.content:
Android Developer - Remote Role - Attending Regular Meetings in Uxbridge - UB8

We are currently recruiting for an experienced Android Developer, to join our company as a remote worker based in the UK who is able to attend meetings in Uxbridge on a regular basis. We are a fast-growing company with a clear market leading position in the UK Care sector. This is a full-time opportunity, supporting flexible hours. You will be responsible for the creation of high-quality, industry leading Mobile Applications for our clients, constantly seeking to learn and improve, actively research, develop and recommend practices, platforms, features and best practice.

Benefits:

29+ days annual leave
Flexible working
Pension
Perkbox employee rewards (childcare vouchers, dining, shopping and entertainment discounts)
Parking paid
Local gym membership

Skills & experience required:

Full understanding of the Software Delivery Lifecycle.
Strong understanding and experience of working with the Android SDK, Kotlin and Android Studio.
Strong understanding of secure coding practices.
Able to contribute to the design of REST APIs.
Mastery of object-oriented programming paradigms -SOLID, GRASP and Hollywood Principle
Versed in version control and Agile Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools - Ideally Git and Azure DevOps.
Experience of working with Fabric (Answers, Crashlytics, Twitter), Google Analytics, Firebase, Google SDK, Localisations and Push Notifications.
Experienced in test automation CI/CD.
Understanding of Human Interface Guidelines.
Experience of working with remote/offshore developers and testers.
Familiar with at least one Agile methodology - preferably Scrum.

Responsibilities:

Building state of the art mobile apps for a rapidly growing user base.
Maintain and enhance mobile applications by addressing bugs and introducing new features
Demonstrate new features to colleagues prior to release.
Contribute throughout the software development life cycle.
Interacting with UI / UX designers to achieve an aspirational UX which is suitable for our clients.
Participating in pull requests and code reviews.
Regularly assessing and improving anything that affects you, your team or the company.
Proactively research development practices, products and mobile devices to recommend, research and develop valuable features

If this sounds like you please send us your CV through the link, and we will give you a call for a confidential chat. Alternatively please give us a call at (phone number removed) and ask for Cris, and we will be more than happy to go through the role in more details, with a view to arrange an interview with you

items.title: Senior Android Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=25, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=2, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Android Engineer

Job Description

We are a world leading online classifieds business with household name brands across 22 countries.  Our brands include Leboncoin.fr, OLX, Vibbo.com, fotocasa, infojobs and Shpock to name a few.

Our brands are supported by tech hubs in Paris and Barcelona.  Their goal is to develop common global product & innovation platforms which all of our brands can leverage; creating data and identity based ecosystems; empowering local entrepreneurs, delighting users, and helping us achieve our mission of creating perfect matches on the world's most trusted marketplaces.  

Our Touchstone team’s mission is to create easy to integrate customisable drop-in components for each of our Marketplaces to use in their apps and sites. The team is data-informed, utilising the A/B experimentation techniques to prove and improve the components that we offer to marketplaces to improve their users’ experiences.

Why join this team: Join a team building highly-visible, data-informed products. Build components that tie together predictive machine learning models built by data science teams, that leverage image recognition and personalisation algorithms. Be part of a team that build and run their software with full control and ownership. Learn from your mistakes and from the mistakes of others and strive for continuous improvement.

Responsibilities

    • Build state of the art components that have real revenue-generating impact
    • Working in a multi-disciplinary team here in London & Paris and alongside colleagues throughout Europe
    • Be creative and experiment with new solutions but pragmatic and committed to code optimisation, maintainability, and quality that can scale to a large user base
    • Help define our development environment, and communicate the best development practices within the organisation (i.e. code reviews, testing, etc)
    • Work closely with other teams (Stakeholders, Product and UX) to drive product development in an iterative and agile way
    • Leading discussions and contributing to technical decisions, striving for clean architecture


Qualifications

Requirements

    • 2+ years of experience of Android development, Kotlin a big plus
    • Distinctiveness - someone who can help us raise the bar.
    • Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems; with real intellectual curiosity and generalism
    • Demonstrated mastery and deep experience of developing Android SDKs - ideally with experience shipping robust mobile technologies or cutting-edge apps that have been enjoyed by large numbers of users.
    • Excellent, deep experience of Java/Kotlin are (of course) necessary - it’s Android!Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services.
    • Someone who has experience working collaboratively with geographically distributed teams (we have hubs in London, Barcelona, Stockholm and Oslo) would be preferable.
    • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git and familiarity with Continuous Integration.

Desirable Experience (which you’ll be exposed to, if you’re not already)

    • Experience with server side technologies for building web services for mobile devices
    • CI/CD build pipelines
    • DDD, SOLID, TDD
    • AWS or any other cloud platform
    • High comfort level working with multiple stakeholders from different parts of the organisation toward a consensus
    • iOS/web development experience/interest a bonus

If this sounds like you it would be great to have a conversation, the first step is to click apply.

Apply now

items.content:
Android Developer at SpringboardVR

Remote | Freelance | International

REMOTE · Toronto, Ontario, Canada · Development

DESCRIPTION

SpringboardVR is the fastest growing Virtual Reality arcade management platform outside of China, and we are looking to expand our development team! Our development team is currently 9 people located across 5 countries working in PHP, Go, C#, and Javascript. Because we are a small team everyone has a chance to take ownership over different projects and products with control over all the technical decisions on how things get built. We love trying new things!

We are looking to bring on a developer to lead our Android and Unity projects at SpringboardVR. This position will be very self directed and we are definitely looking for someone who is a self starter and is able to take any task and own it from start to finish. You will be developing an Android based MDM software and will work closely with our backend API developers. You will also be working on VR based Unity projects for Android VR headsets.

This is a full time contract position for 40 hours a week. We are unable to provide any Visa sponsorship.

This is a fully remote position and we are a fully remote company! Our current development team is located across the Americas, Europe, and South Korea.

We are open to someone in any timezone, with a preference to North America and Europe.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Android Development Experience (Kotlin or Java)
  • Unity Development Experience
  • Can handle constructive criticism
  • Self directed

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience working with a fully remote team
  • MDM Development Experience
  • Experience with other languages – C#, Go

BENEFITS:

This is a full time contractor position with the possibility of becoming a salaried employee in the future for U.S. citizens.

  • Salary between $25 and $50 per hour
  • Working 40 hours a week with no overtime, we value work/life balance!
  • Paid every 2 weeks
  • Initially a 3 month trial period contract followed by a 1 year contract
  • Fully remote team
Apply for job

Company: Raisin

Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • iOS
  • Jenkins
  • Mobile Product Development
  • React Native

    • Intro

    “Raisin goes mobile”!

    Your mission as an experienced React Native Developer is to build great solutions with delighting UI’s as well as an amazing mobile user experience.
    You are part of a cross-functional team of pioneers, crafting the first mobile solution for a market proven and successful business model.
    Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    • Together with your team, you will own the concept, design, implementation and deployment of our customer-facing mobile apps
    • You are actively participating in agile and collaborative processes
    • You are responsible to keep high-quality standards of software craftsmanship and low tech debt
    • Finally, you are responsible for continuously improving your team as well as yourself

    Main requirements

    • You have been working as a React Native or Mobile Developer for at least 3 years
    • You have strong experience with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcase your experience
    • You have solid practical knowledge in app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews

Android Developer

If you are an Android Developer with experience, please read on!

We combine decades of knowledge about exceptional online customer experience with a deep understanding of what a particular bank, insurer or investment company needs. Our business model accelerates the startup and innovation projects in every stage of developing new ideas, so you can deliver fast, personalized and mobile services to your customers. This translates to personalized customer experience, increased loyalty, higher conversion rates, and shortened time to market.

We have TWO open positions! You will play a critical role in helping us guide our clientele through the exciting digital transformation process of financial services. The successful candidate will work in a consultant/client-facing role directly with our customers to provide and enhance customer engagement. Focusing on Android Development, you will streamline and manage customer digital interactions across all channels. Our goal is to build a team with a good blend of strong client-facing communication skills, hardcore developer/architect and designer experience.

Remote iOS Tech Lead | £70,000 | Surrey

Swift/UIKit/CoreData/Objective C

Job Summary

My client is an exciting tech firm that builds high performance mobile applications for a number of international clients, spanning over 70 countries. Due to growth, they are looking to bring on a talented iOS Tech Lead to join their exisiting team.

This role is open for a talented iOS Developer to work on a fully remote basis, albeit you would be required on site in Surrey for the occasional team or client meeting.

The main responsibility for the role will be to ensure the smooth delivery of iOS projects for external clients, starting from working with stakeholders and requirement taking, to the delivery of the final project. The Tech Lead will be responsible for overseeing projects and working to help other members of the team with technical guidance.

This role provides the opportunity to work on projects for a number of renowned brands with a highly talented team. My client looks to provide a great team culture and benefits packages, which includes flexible working hours and the option for unlimited holiday.

Key Skills

- Experience with coding in Swift for iOS

- Knowledge of iOS Frameworks such as UIKit, CoreDate, Corelocation etc

- Experience of working with third party librairies and API

- Some knowledge RxSwift

- Some knowledge of Objective C

- Working experience of CI/CD

Further Information

If you'd like further information about the role, please get in touch with Tom Farrington at Premier IT.

Be aware that the Tech Lead would be required to be based in the UK and there is no visa sponsorship available

items.content:
Chapter Lead Mobile (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Application Development
  • Mobile Web Design

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €195 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.
    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. 
    Your mission as an experienced Leader & React Native Developer is to enable teams to build great solutions with delighting UI’s and an amazing mobile user experience. Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    Your responsibilities:

    • You are Chapter lead, with accountability for the improvement of our overall mobile engineering capability, including talent, workflows and tools
    • You are Key contributor in a cross-functional mobile team
    • You are a hands-on team lead and mentor
    • You ensure a high working morale, teamspirit, and productivity
    • You develop both your chapter’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs
    • You coach your chapter to remove obstacles independently, but you also get your hands dirty, when needed
    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility
    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organization
    • You are a great communicator and empathetic motivator when needed 

    Main requirements

     Your profile:

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience
    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in collaborative way
    • Entrepreneurial mind-set and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment
    • You have strong experience (3y)  with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcases your experience
    • You have a deep understanding of the app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
    • You are an open-minded and creative team player enjoying constructive code and architecture discussions
    • Writing clean, maintainable and well documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code
    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus
    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory 
     
    Our benefits:

     Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,500 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.content:
Senior Android Developer at Polarr

Remote | International

SAN JOSE, CA; SHENZHEN, CHINA; BEIJING, CHINA; BARCELONA, SPAIN OR REMOTE

ENGINEERING

FULL TIME

Polarr is looking for a Senior Android developer who’re familiar with video processing as well as knowledge of Tensorflow to bring new interactive A.I. experiences to modern applications.

You Have:

  • Architected and built standalone apps with custom UI elements from scratch
  • Worked with animation frameworks where you can smoothly animate elements and transform them following complex design requirements
  • Implemented test driven design and accomplished high test coverage for applications you’ve written
  • Dealt with low end device development where you optimized RAM performance and UI rendering frame rate

You Will:

  • Work on complex video and image processing apps with high memory footprint and CPU usage.
  • Exploring and implementing AI related user features using CoreML and other AI frameworks
  • Engineer video and image processing engines that help Polarr users make sophisticated visual effects
  • Implement UI/UX design elements
  • Experimenting with CoreML AI modules and integrating them with the application experience
  • Optimizing app launch speed and performance for lower RAM and CPU usage and reducing crashes

You Are:

  • Considerate of how your code will interface with future versions of Android (forward’s compatibility)
  • Architecture first rather than jumping into writing implementation code
  • Aware of the latest nuances of Android frameworks and understand how to make them backwards compatible with older devices
  • Obsessed with the details, imperfections, no matter how small, are cause for concern
  • User experience driven, the positive experience of the user plays a big part in what you do.
  • Learn more about our values, mission and team at our careers page!
  • Take a look at To Prospective Team Members of Polarr, a short blog written by our co-founders for even more info.
  • Benefits and perks: https://www.notion.so/polarr/Company-Perks-03664102040348dfa8da7c4c65deec6c

Our Mission: To enable and inspire everyone to make beautiful creations.

What is Polarr?:

Polarr is building the world’s largest knowledge base of visual effect, with a mission to enable and inspire everyone to make beautiful creations. Over the last 4 years, our company built a unique ecosystem of visual effects creators and developers such as Samsung, OPPO, Western Digital where millions of visual effects are shared and used every month.

Apply for job

SpringboardVR is the fastest growing Virtual Reality arcade management platform outside of China, and we are looking to expand our development team! Because we are a small team everyone has a chance to take ownership over different projects and products with control over all the technical decisions on how things get built.   • Android Development Experience (Kotlin or Java)

  • Can handle constructive criticism
  • Self directed


Nice to Haves
  • Experience working with a fully remote team
  • MDM Development Experience
  • Experience with other languages - C#, Go

BENEFITS
This is a full time contractor position with the possibility of becoming a salaried employee in the future for U.S. citizens.
  • Salary between $25 and $50 per hour
  • Working 40 hours a week with no overtime, we value work/life balance!
  • Paid every 2 weeks
  • Initially a 3 month trial period contract followed by a 1 year contract
  • Fully remote team

items.content:
Android Developer (Omvana Meditation App)

Be part of the team that is expanding the #1 Meditation App in Over 30 Countries with over 1.5M Downloads while working in an international team of 55+ countries and making an impact on the world through great tech products. All, while enjoying the amazing lifestyle that only South East Asia can provide you.  

About the Role

Omvana is Mindvalley’s baby, first created in 2013. It became the World’s #1 Meditation App in Over 30 Countries with over 1.5M downloads. It is a project born out of a crazy idea, allowing people to mix their meditations with different sounds as a fun and engaging way to retain people on one of the world’s most ancient, healthy and effective mindfulness practices.

That crazy idea was nurtured and it soon became worthy of the attention of the most remarkable publications out there, from  to renomated newspapers such as   on the health field like  and resulting in more than 29,000 mentions through the internet. But more than our numbers, we are proud of the positive impact Omvana has caused on hundreds of thousands of lives, and now, we intend to expand this project and reach the hundreds of millions. 

And we are looking for smart people, like you, to help us achieve this goal. 

Being one of our developers, you'll have an opportunity to learn and grow your technical as well as personal skills. The ability to write performant and clean code with great attention to detail is essential, but you will be part of something bigger than building features. We hope you are interested because we want you to: 

  • Participate in the product creation working closely with UX designers and Product Managers; 
  • Ensure performance, quality and responsiveness;
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs;
  • Be open to learn and share knowledge with the team;
  • Contribute. From code architecture to product features to visual designs; 

You are more than just a developer, someone who understands that a great app must do great things yet is simple and intuitive. You are pixel-perfect, knowing that a pixel to the right is not merely a pixel to the right. You understand that an organised code with the well-applied design patterns will make a difference. You are fascinated about technology and eager to learn everything you can, applying the coolest and most amazing techniques there are. You add a "magic touch" that will dazzle your users.

 Requirements

  • Java, Android framework, Gradle
  • Kotlin is strongly preferred
  • Experience with clean architecture and MVVM
  • Experience with Dependency Injections
  • Experience with Rx
  • Writing Unit Test Cases is a must
  • Team player attitude
  • Good communication skills
  • In addition to having excellent technical skills, you have a keen interest in the latest technologies and have a feel for user experience
  • Practical understanding of Continuous Integration and Delivery

Have you worked on any Android app? Include your portfolio in your resume!

On the personal side

  • Interested in personal development, meditation, health & fitness or related topics 
  • Great logic and problem solving skills
  • Effective communication skills
  • You feel comfortable (and enjoy) working outside your comfort zone
  • Be a team player, willing to do whatever is necessary to deliver a great product

This position requires you to be initially, physically located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and remote working is possible but limited and according to the team’s needs. We want you close because what we want and offer is the understanding of the big picture where you can see how what you are developing impact the metrics and the business.

Apply now

Apply now

Lead Application Engineer - SwiftUI, Combine, Architecture, Data Model

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Advertising, Graphic Design, Visual Effects
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: LiveSurface | No office location

Technologies

swift
uikit
swiftui
objective-c
combine

Job description

LiveSurface is an industry leader in visualization and image creation tools for creatives. We blend leading technology with hand-curated content to provide realtime photorealistic visualization to our users. At our heart, we are a team of creatives that thrive on transforming challenging problems into beautifully implemented solutions.

We are seeking a talented lead application engineer to join our team and help us to build the next generation of LiveSurface products. Interested in joining us? We’d love to hear from you.

Lead Application Engineer

What you’ll do:
_ Build the next generation of LiveSurface visualization products.
_ Leverage the latest frameworks (SwiftUI, Combine, Swift 5.x) to build new products.
_ Work with the team to build a product roadmap and define milestones.
_ Plan and research best technologies, pulling primarily from Apple Frameworks.
_ Contribute to the overall product vision.
_ Architect clean, reusable and maintainable modules.
_ Work tightly with render engine lead to integrate and influence the render engine design.
_ Refactor, optimize and pull from existing code from LiveSurface frameworks.
_ Deliver beautiful, well implemented code that is performant and easy to understand.

Who you are:
_ A university graduate with an undergraduate degree or better.
_ An experienced engineer with a minimum of 5 years working on UI code.
_ A fast learner, able to adapt to new frameworks quickly.
_ Experienced in creating iOS/macOS applications using Xcode.
_ Up-to-date with the latest frameworks.
_ Fluent in Swift, Objective-C and Apple Frameworks.
_ Experienced in using Apple Frameworks to create custom experiences.
_ An English speaker with strong communication skills.
_ Equally good at architecting as you are with refactoring.
_ Obsessed with clean, reusable modular architecture.
_ Focused on workflow and user experience.

We offer:
_ Remote work and a flexible schedule.
_ A wide range of challenging problems to solve.
_ A stable, revenue-based structure with an existing product (on the market for 5+ years).
_ Broad exposure: Your work will be seen and loved by thousands of users.
_ A highly acclaimed platform with a loyal user base.
_ A small, friendly, engineering team.
_ Product-focused, non-corporate management.

Extras that will make you stand out:
_ A background in graphics and gaming.
_ Knowledge of C, C++.
_ Experience with using Adobe and other industry standard graphics tools.

More about Context:
http://www.livesurface.com/context.php


Apply now

About LiveSurface

LiveSurface was founded by an Apple alum designer/entrepreneur with 25+ years in the branding and design fields and 10+ years software engineering on macOS/iOS platforms.

Our small, talented team is distributed and lives in California, New York, Spain, Israel, Portugal, Germany. We love challenging problems and creating beautifully implemented solutions. We are split about evenly between engineering and content/marketing.

Our current customers include boutique design studios, well-know advertising/design agencies and some of the biggest names in Silicon Valley.

Benefits

  • Remote work
  • Flexible schedule
  • Nice people
  • Collaborative workflow
  • Product-focused approach

items.content:
Lead Remote Android / Unity Developer

DESCRIPTION

SpringboardVR is the fastest growing Virtual Reality arcade management platform outside of China, and we are looking to expand our development team! Our development team is currently 9 people located across 5 countries working in PHP, Go, C#, and Javascript. Because we are a small team everyone has a chance to take ownership over different projects and products with control over all the technical decisions on how things get built. We love trying new things!


We are looking to bring on a developer to lead our Android and Unity projects at SpringboardVR. This position will be very self directed and we are definitely looking for someone who is a self starter and is able to take any task and own it from start to finish. You will be developing an Android based MDM software and will work closely with our backend API developers. You will also be working on VR based Unity projects for Android VR headsets.


This is a full time contract position for 40 hours a week. We are unable to provide any Visa sponsorship.


This is a fully remote position and we are a fully remote company! Our current development team is located across the Americas, Europe, and South Korea.


We are open to someone in any timezone, with a preference to North America and Europe.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Android Development Experience (Kotlin or Java)
  • Unity Development Experience
  • Can handle constructive criticism
  • Self directed


Nice to Haves
  • Experience working with a fully remote team
  • MDM Development Experience
  • Experience with other languages - C#, Go

BENEFITS
This is a full time contractor position with the possibility of becoming a salaried employee in the future for U.S. citizens.
  • Salary between $25 and $50 per hour
  • Working 40 hours a week with no overtime, we value work/life balance!
  • Paid every 2 weeks
  • Initially a 3 month trial period contract followed by a 1 year contract
  • Fully remote team

items.content:
Android Developer at Lookback

Remote | International

Lookback is a cash flow positive, remote-first, SaaS startup from Stockholm, with headquarters in Palo Alto. We are hiring a senior Android developer to rewrite our Video/WebRTC recording app (and beyond).

We have a functioning Android app, but it needs a full rewrite to:

  • Improve stability. Lookback is known for being rock-solid, and our Android app needs to up the game.
  • Prepare for the future. We have product developments to push into the app further down the line.
  • Great Android “feel”. The app should showcase a strong Android UI experience.

To do this, we need you to have lots of experience in developing Android apps. We like Kotlin and functional reactive programming, but are open to pushing the envelope. We extensively use Video and WebRTC technologies: some experience in that is good, but we also have in-house devs in this area to guide you.

Our Android app works, but our current developer has shifted priorities, hence we want to recruit.

We offer competitive salaries, stock options, a 401(k) with a 4% match, health insurance that is 100% covered by us, and 30 days of vacation per year which we expect you to use.

We have a small but highly competent team of engineers and a hands-off management culture. And we love building tech.

The position will be based remote in Europe or North America.

Apply for job

Ionic Mobile Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

mobile
android
ios
ionic

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking a Mobile Developer who has a strong background in Ionic to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient mobile applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Ionic framework experience required
  • Ionic Pro experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies* Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

REMOTE

3 openings

The ideal candidate will have experience building iOS applications (Swift) that rely on multiple web services and that operate at scale (millions of users), as well as home automation devices and wireless mesh networks (e.g. ZigBee and Z-Wave), and have a strong bias for clean, reusable code, testability and automation.

What you will do as an iOS Developer:

  • 3+ years of experience creating native iOS applications.
  • Familiarity with common iOS languages and libraries like Swift, RxSwift.
  • Extensive hands-on experience creating custom UI controls, designing protocols, implementing interfaces, and performance optimization.
  • Working knowledge of web services & REST APIs.
  • Ability to think critically and independently.
  • A strong passion for learning and adapting to new technologies.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What you will bring to the table as an iOS Developer:

- Experience working with IoT frameworks or platforms.

- Knowledge of source control and code review systems (Github, Gerrit)

- Ability to effectively communicate technical challenges and solutions

- Experience with automating workflows for software development builds and deployments

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Ionic Mobile Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

mobile
android
ios
ionic

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking a Mobile Developer who has a strong background in Ionic to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient mobile applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Ionic framework experience required
  • Ionic Pro experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies* Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend
